name: TheAtlantic
text: “It takes political leadership to fix this sort of moment,” Wisconsin’s lieutenant governor says. But Trump, he suggests, “is only making things worse.” https://t.co/l4PafW3Rzk

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: QAnon carries on a tradition of apocalyptic thinking that has spanned thousands of years. It offers a polemic to empower those who feel adrift. And it's not going anywhere. https://t.co/IkVndDeGha

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Many young people navigating this pandemic are asking themselves a two-part health question: What are the odds that I get infected? And if I do get infected, is that really a big deal?" @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/xFOxukxOHd

name: TheAtlantic
text: New #DearTherapist with @LoriGottlieb1: “I did my best to help our son have a rewarding life, as did his father, but the happy times were few, and his struggles were many and heartbreaking.” https://t.co/2PckZIiUKY

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The silence is resounding,” writes @DavidFrum. “And when such voices do speak, they typically describe a president utterly lacking in empathy to grieving families, wholly uncomprehending of sacrifice and suffering." https://t.co/TTyiKPcIh2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Considering the poor working conditions, low wages, and lack of benefits that have characterized their job for years, cafeteria workers stand to take one of the biggest hits if more schools have outbreaks. https://t.co/nrPwPXLWYE

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: Just over 4.6 million people live in the state of Louisiana, a state well known for its music, food, and festivals, many of which take place in its largest city, New Orleans—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/agJEl14OGC

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Mulan” is at its best when it indulges in flights of fancy. @davidlsims on the new Disney film’s preoccupation with gravitas: https://t.co/SNVgR6ohVU

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: Hong Kong's leaders are blatantly rewriting history, writes @TMclaughlin3.

"Yet even if no one is convinced, the propaganda itself is the point, a show of the state’s ability to lie, and face no consequence." 

https://t.co/rwX6RROge2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: "Trump was elected president on a promise to restore an idealized past in which America’s traditional aristocracy of race was unquestioned. But rather than restore that aristocracy, four years of catastrophe have—at least for the moment—discredited it.” https://t.co/0IPV7Jy0hf

name: TheAtlantic
text: The first of our three October cover stories is out now. Read @AdamSerwer on how the United States has its best opportunity in 150 years to belatedly fulfill its promise as a multiracial democracy. https://t.co/1HEUw2OGJ9 https://t.co/wzeSgnicPs

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Voting in person during the coronavirus pandemic is about as safe as going to the grocery store, @RussellBerman reports.
https://t.co/sHAr2heQVr

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: Hong Kong's leaders are blatantly rewriting history. Yet, as @TMcLaughlin3 writes, "even if no one is convinced, the propaganda itself is the point, a show of the state’s ability to lie, and face no consequence." https://t.co/ZNLJ1A8z3k

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @russellberman: "It's like shopping." Public-health experts now say that in-person voting is as safe as going to the grocery store, with the proper precautions. Will Democrats get that message out to their voters? https://t.co/vdrw2tW587

name: TheAtlantic
text: Related: @TMclaughlin3 profiled Hong Kong’s chief executive, Carrie Lam, in June. https://t.co/hdoWxPpzQA

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If Americans follow that advice and dedicate half as much energy to working within the electoral system as they have on this year’s protests, then the gains of the next five years may well dwarf those of the past 30," @conor64 writes: https://t.co/BE1f3IITbb

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "It is not an uncommon tactic among autocratic regimes, wiping problematic episodes from the historical narrative, presenting the status quo as a moment that was never in doubt. The authorities in Hong Kong are going a step further." Read @TMclaughlin3 https://t.co/ZNLJ1A8z3k
